items.title: When a Walkable City Becomes a Death Trap
items.abstract: Vision Zero, the initiative to eliminate traffic fatalities, seems to have stalled, if the reoccurring tragedies on a single Brooklyn avenue are any proof.

items.title: Why New York City’s Best Won’t Be Enough to Solve the Migrant Crisis
items.abstract: The city has frantically sought to uphold its promise of shelter for all. But as more people arrive, services are being stretched past their capacity.

items.title: ‘Blue’s Big City Adventure’ Review: It’s Gotta Be the Clues
items.abstract: The beloved children’s series “Blue’s Clues” gets a splashy, exuberant musical.

items.title: The Big Oyster and the Big City
items.abstract: The largest oyster found in New York Harbor in perhaps 100 years was a reminder of the era when the oyster was not the world, perhaps, but certainly New York City.

items.title: Bill de Blasio’s Big Plans for New York
items.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio came out fighting for affordable housing, envisioning a city able to retain the working- and middle-class families that call it home.
